ratings.comment: This is the worst class I've ever taken. He just reads the slides and TRYS to explain whatever is on them, sometimes he gets lost on his own explanation. Lectures are behind from the assignments so expect to teach yourself some of the concepts. Assignments nor lectures helped for the midterm nor the final...

The lectures were absolutely of no use.I went to all lectures, and compared to people who didn't attend lectures I did not know any more info.The class was behind on material for the whole semester, to the point where we were taught a concept on Tuesday and the assignment on that concept was due Thursday at 9:30am, but was released a week earlier.

He wasn't the best professor since he was basically just reading off of the slides that were shared by the other professors. He was nice, but you would be better off taking the class with Fred Sala instead if you want to learn the material.

I dont see why Professor Laing gets so many negative comments here, because the class is actually helpful. All exercises and homework get me ready for building some machine learning projects and better understand all those concepts. Professor himself is willing to help, I remember one time he replied email 6 in the morning. Though exams are tough!
worst professor i have ever seen.

Never take his course!!!!!!!!! The lecture is extremely boring and useless. His homework, lecture, and exam are eventually do not have any relevance. The final exam is not concern about any knowledge you learned in this class, the final exam is pretty like purchase the lottery tickets. The is the most horrible class I have taken in my life!!!!!!

CS540 was my most painful experience since being tear-gassed in basic training. 10% material was taught to the extent it was tested. He uses stolen assignments from other universities creating chaos because he can't accurately judge how to test us on things he didn't create. Lectures are useless and painful to sit through.
I have never seen a course so poorly designed and administered.

This prof doesn't seem to care about his students. His slides are high level (and most aren't his), he expects you to know low level details for the exam problems, and even getting 100% on all of the homeworks won't prepare you to get a 40% on the final. Good luck, teach yourself everything, and see the future so you know how to study for the final

Yingyu is a descent professor. His lectures can occasionally be a little slow moving where we get stuck on a topic for a while or where he focuses too much on math proofs. He's approachable before or after lecture to answer questions and is helpful. His exam contained expected topics but a few questions didn't seem to relate to course topics.

Boring lecture, attendance dropped drastically within the first week. Going to the lecture does not teach you anything you need to know for the worksheets or the exams. Lecture is dumbed down, the sheet and the exam hits you in the face because no-one ever taught you how to do this stuff, so you gotta figure it out yourself.
Just reads off the slides the entire lecture. Attendance dropped to 50% only two weeks after the first day of classes.

He is very nice. In his machine learning class, he offered some new and hot topics, like reinforce learning and deep learning. The course projects are awesome. I learn a lot from them. The final project allowed me to do some wonderful research on the interesting topic that he gave us. And he was always willing to brainstorm research ideas with us.

He is kind and nice. He is new and reads slides from time to time. But he is always willing to stop and answer questions in detail. He really knows a lot about this area. The final project topics he offered us were really amazing to do. He is also kind enough to offer us CPT signatures while other professors don't.
Nice guy. The course gives a high point of view of machine learning, though may be to abstract for some of the students. willing to answer question after class.
He is very nice.

This class had so much potential to be impactful to students but failed in every way. Professor was new to the university so he reused lectures and homework from past semesters. It felt like he read off the slides in a very general way and tested us on totally random stuff. Midterm did not seem reflective of course material. Would never recommend.

Worst Prof I have ever seen. Taken sildes from another prof and just basically reads them out without explaining. Exam is nothing alikes to past exam. You wont be doing good no matter you go to class or not.

I'm taking his CS 540 class. I mean, the stuff is super easy, or it should be. However, he successfully turned it into a mess for me. Boring and meaningless lectures with his poor explanation. Homework and exam, nonsense. You won't benefit from preparing for it. CS professors always refresh my recognition for bad professors. He's not an exception.

Bad. Does not explains anything. He just reads the slides in a monotonic way, very boring. Just shows some mathematical equations and expects you to understand them. Gives no intuition that why a particular methods works or what that method is trying to achieve. Please avoid.
Forgot to submit an assignment until after a lecture (was due at beginning of lecture but assignment was done already). Professor would not let me turn it in. It wasn't a small assignment.
